DataElement.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the soft tissue sarcoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Clinical M Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3-29-19 Transferred DEC ownership from NCIP to NCI Standards; tmt. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology_One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis._A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7 American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
